result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Michael Coulter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must obtain GED or equivalent.

No consumption of alcohol & no entry into any bars or taverns.

If energy drinks interfere with medications - defendant must not consume unless verification is provided by health care provider.
Court authorizes expungement under 973.015 if all conditions of probation are complied with and upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant must complete and follow through with an anger management program.
Defendant must follow all treatment conditions of Chapter 51 Commitment.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count 1, except no additional community service hours.
Concurrent with: Count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Michael Coulter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan Michael Coulter in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:05 PM. State - Victim Impact Statement submitted to the court. Burns has provided court with PLQ. Court reviews victim impact statement. State - victim is present in courtroom. State - has agreement - defend would enter G plea to counts 1 & 2 place on probation for 2 years, costs on each count. Counts 3 & 4 DRI. Conditions: AODA assessment, anger management and phycological assessment and follow through, must not consume or possess alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, full time emp/schooling, 75 hours  community service, take all medication as prescribed by doctor. Court dismisses but reads in counts 3 & 4. Coulter pleads G to both counts 1 & 2 with domestic abuse enhancer. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds he is entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently, waives his constitutional rights, court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State makes final statement and states conditions of that are not needed are physiological assessment and employment, due to defendant already on SSI, other than that asks court to follow recommendation. Burns asks to follow recommendation, 8 days jail credit if revoked. Coulter makes statement, remorseful. Victim makes statement. Court will adopt joint recommendation and sentences to the following: Counts 1 & 2 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, with conditions of: costs on each count, AODA and follow through with all recommendations, complete and follow through with anger management program, follow all treatment conditions of Chapter 51 commitment, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, obtain GED, 75 hours community service, take all medication as prescribed by doctor, if energy drinks interfere with medications, must not consume unless verification is provided by health care provider, 8 days credit if revoked. Appeal rights given, DNA sample required. Burns ask for expungement. Court will authorized expungement under 973.015 if all conditions are complied with and upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant Ryan Michael Coulter in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:07 PM. State - believes the PH will be waived and have filed an Information in anticipation of that waiver. Burns and Coulter agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Burns has Information that mirrors the complaint, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan Michael Coulter in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:28 AM. Burns has went over complaint with defendant and waives further reading, waives time limits for PH. Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant appears via video from FOSO with his attorney Mary Burns appearing in person. Charles Simono appears for the State. Called 9:43 AM - State here for temp date and has not been filed yet due to needing more information. Burns - indicates his in on a probation hold and awaiting a revocation hearing. State does have the requested info, DA just has not had a chance to review it. INIT 9/9/15 @ 9 a.m. Bond continued. Defendant makes statement.
Voluntary waiver request to waive the court ordered no contact provision
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim

Called at 9:37 am. Ryan Coultr appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Mary Burns appears in person. No complaint filed. court reviews probable cause for DA purposes. Recess to allow DA time to get their information. Coulter is on a PO hold. Back on record at 9:40 AM. Burns asks for signature bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - $3000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no contact with victim. Defendant's mother makes statement regarding the no-contact provision. Court - bond as stated previous. Court sets for AIA on 8/27/15 @ 9:30 AM.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim Wayne Coulter
